timeline.bodyText: Instead of returning a possibly null node, shall we use Optional here?
timeline.author: nadeeshaan

replies.bodyText:
Since this method is called recursively to find the effective parent node for indentation, converting its return type to optional seems to clutter the code without much of a benefit IMO, or is there something that I might be missing here?
A null return value is expected in a case where a node has no parent. Here, there won't be an addition of columns to the existing indentation.
replies.author: IrushiL

timeline.bodyText: Since the if, else-if ladder is complex, shall we stick to individual if clauses? It seems we return within each clause and there is no fall through.this way we can remove several inner else clauses and will become the logic bit cleaner
timeline.author: nadeeshaan
nadeeshaan

timeline.bodyText: Effectively we return here a null, is it possible to return an Optional as the return type of the method?
timeline.author: nadeeshaan

replies.bodyText: Here the intended behavior is to return the token itself if the token value sent for the formatToken method is null. Since we can't really replace a null token with a different value, is there a benefit of wrapping it around an Optional?
replies.author: IrushiL

replies.bodyText: When we wrapping inside an Optional, particular API usage has to explicitly check for the isPresent. Otherwise there is a chance we are missing the null check and run into NPEs.
replies.author: nadeeshaan

replies.bodyText: I see. I will incorporate this in the refactoring PR.
